fields.title: Central African Republic Conflict - ETC Situation Report #63 (Reporting period: 01/04/2023 to 30/04/2023)
fields.body:
*The ETC was activated in C.A.R. in December 2013 in response to the conflict crisis. ETC Situation Reports are distributed every month.*

**Highlights**

- The WFP TEC Chief Information Officer (CIO)/Chair of the Global ETC as well as the WFP Regional Bureau for Western Africa (RBD) Regional IT Officer (RITO) visited the Learning Centre and Cyber Café in Bangassou on 7 April to observe ongoing activities. Partners INTERSOS and Central African Red Cross were also part of the mission.

- The first batch of 60 learners completed the computer training course at the Learning Centre and Cyber Café in Bangassou and were issued certificates of course completion on 7 April. See more about the new Learning Centre in a video here.

- A new configuration in the customer management software platform to enable the establishment of the Common Feedback Mechanism (CFM) in Bangassou and Bouar has been finalized. The CFM enables communities to explain their needs and to request assistance.

text:
# Central African Republic Conflict - ETC Situation Report #63 (Reporting period: 01/04/2023 to 30/04/2023)

*The ETC was activated in C.A.R. in December 2013 in response to the conflict crisis. ETC Situation Reports are distributed every month.*

**Highlights**

- The WFP TEC Chief Information Officer (CIO)/Chair of the Global ETC as well as the WFP Regional Bureau for Western Africa (RBD) Regional IT Officer (RITO) visited the Learning Centre and Cyber Café in Bangassou on 7 April to observe ongoing activities. Partners INTERSOS and Central African Red Cross were also part of the mission.

- The first batch of 60 learners completed the computer training course at the Learning Centre and Cyber Café in Bangassou and were issued certificates of course completion on 7 April. See more about the new Learning Centre in a video here.

- A new configuration in the customer management software platform to enable the establishment of the Common Feedback Mechanism (CFM) in Bangassou and Bouar has been finalized. The CFM enables communities to explain their needs and to request assistance.
summary: The ETC was activated in the Central African Republic in December 2013 in response to the conflict crisis. During the reporting period of April 1-30, the WFP TEC Chief Information Officer and Regional IT Officer visited the Learning Centre and Cyber Café in Bangassou, and the first batch of 60 learners completed the computer training course and were issued certificates. Additionally, a new configuration in the customer management software platform was finalized to enable the establishment of the Common Feedback Mechanism in Bangassou and Bouar.
